sentences.zh: 鄭桓公友者，周厲王少子而宣王庶弟也。

translations.text: Duke Huan of Zheng, named You, was the youngest son of King Li of Zhou and the younger half-brother of King Xuan.

sentences.zh: 宣王立二十二年，友初封于鄭。

translations.text: King Xuan ascended the throne in the twenty-second year, and You was first enfeoffed in Zheng.

sentences.zh: 封三十三歲，百姓皆便愛之。

translations.text: He was enfeoffed for thirty-three years, and all the common people found him convenient and loved him.

sentences.zh: 幽王以為司徒。

translations.text: King You appointed him as Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 和集周民，周民皆說，河雒之閒，人便思之。

translations.text: He harmonized and gathered the Zhou people, and the Zhou people were all pleased. Between the Yellow River and Luo River, people conveniently remembered him.

sentences.zh: 為司徒一歲，幽王以褒后故，王室治多邪，諸侯或畔之。

translations.text: He served as Minister of Works for one year, but King You, because of the Bao consort's influence, had many evil affairs in governing the royal house, and some feudal lords rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 於是桓公問太史伯曰：「王室多故，予安逃死乎？」

translations.text: Thus Duke Huan asked Grand Historian Bo: 'The royal house has many troubles - where can I escape death?'

sentences.zh: 太史伯對曰：「獨雒之東土，河濟之南可居。」

translations.text: Grand Historian Bo replied: 'Only the eastern lands beyond Luo, south of the Yellow River and Ji River, are habitable.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「何以？」

translations.text: The duke said: 'Why?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「地近虢、鄶，虢、鄶之君貪而好利，百姓不附。

translations.text: He replied: 'The land borders Guo and Huo. The lords of Guo and Huo are greedy and fond of profit, so the common people do not attach themselves to them.

sentences.zh: 今公為司徒，民皆愛公，公誠請居之，虢、鄶之君見公方用事，輕分公地。

translations.text: Now you serve as Minister of Works, and the people all love you. If you sincerely request to reside there, the lords of Guo and Huo, seeing that you are in power, will lightly divide land for you.

sentences.zh: 公誠居之，虢、鄶之民皆公之民也。」

translations.text: If you sincerely reside there, the people of Guo and Huo will all become your people.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「吾欲南之江上，何如？」

translations.text: The duke said: 'I want to go south to the Jiang River - how about that?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「昔祝融為高辛氏火正，其功大矣，而其於周未有興者，楚其後也。

translations.text: He replied: 'In ancient times, Zhu Rong served as Minister of Fire under Gao Xin, and his merit was great, but during the Zhou period he had no rising descendants. Chu is his descendant.

sentences.zh: 周衰，楚必興。

translations.text: When Zhou declines, Chu will surely rise.

sentences.zh: 興，非鄭之利也。」

translations.text: Their rise would not be advantageous for Zheng.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「吾欲居西方，何如？」

translations.text: The duke said: 'I want to reside in the west - how about that?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「其民貪而好利，難久居。」

translations.text: He replied: 'Their people are greedy and fond of profit - difficult to reside in for long.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「周衰，何國興者？」

translations.text: The duke said: 'When Zhou declines, which states will rise?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「齊、秦、晉、楚乎？

translations.text: He replied: 'Qi, Qin, Jin, Chu perhaps?

sentences.zh: 夫齊，姜姓，伯夷之後也，伯夷佐堯典禮。

translations.text: Qi is of the Jiang surname, descendants of Bo Yi. Bo Yi assisted Yao in managing rituals.

sentences.zh: 秦，嬴姓，伯翳之後也，伯翳佐舜懷柔百物。

translations.text: Qin is of the Ying surname, descendants of Bo Yi. Bo Yi assisted Shun in taming and harmonizing the hundred creatures.

sentences.zh: 及楚之先，皆嘗有功於天下。

translations.text: And the ancestors of Chu also once had merit toward the world.

sentences.zh: 而周武王克紂後，成王封叔虞于唐，其地阻險，以此有德與周衰并，亦必興矣。」

translations.text: After King Wu of Zhou defeated Zhou, King Cheng enfeoffed Uncle Yu in Tang. That land is naturally defensible, and with virtue they will parallel Zhou's decline, so they will surely rise.'

sentences.zh: 桓公曰：「善。」

translations.text: Duke Huan said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 於是卒言王，東徙其民雒東，而虢、鄶果獻十邑，竟國之。

translations.text: Thus he finally spoke to the king and moved his people east beyond Luo, and Guo and Huo indeed offered ten cities, completing the state.

Duke Huan of Zheng, named You, was the youngest son of King Li of Zhou and the younger half-brother of King Xuan. King Xuan ascended the throne in the twenty-second year, and You was first enfeoffed in Zheng. He was enfeoffed for thirty-three years, and all the common people found him convenient and loved him. King You appointed him as Minister of Works. He harmonized and gathered the Zhou people, and the Zhou people were all pleased. Between the Yellow River and Luo River, people conveniently remembered him. He served as Minister of Works for one year, but King You, because of the Bao consort's influence, had many evil affairs in governing the royal house, and some feudal lords rebelled against him. Thus Duke Huan asked Grand Historian Bo: 'The royal house has many troubles - where can I escape death?' Grand Historian Bo replied: 'Only the eastern lands beyond Luo, south of the Yellow River and Ji River, are habitable.' The duke said: 'Why?' He replied: 'The land borders Guo and Huo. The lords of Guo and Huo are greedy and fond of profit, so the common people do not attach themselves to them. Now you serve as Minister of Works, and the people all love you. If you sincerely request to reside there, the lords of Guo and Huo, seeing that you are in power, will lightly divide land for you. If you sincerely reside there, the people of Guo and Huo will all become your people.' The duke said: 'I want to go south to the Jiang River - how about that?' He replied: 'In ancient times, Zhu Rong served as Minister of Fire under Gao Xin, and his merit was great, but during the Zhou period he had no rising descendants. Chu is his descendant. When Zhou declines, Chu will surely rise. Their rise would not be advantageous for Zheng.' The duke said: 'I want to reside in the west - how about that?' He replied: 'Their people are greedy and fond of profit - difficult to reside in for long.' The duke said: 'When Zhou declines, which states will rise?' He replied: 'Qi, Qin, Jin, Chu perhaps? Qi is of the Jiang surname, descendants of Bo Yi. Bo Yi assisted Yao in managing rituals. Qin is of the Ying surname, descendants of Bo Yi. Bo Yi assisted Shun in taming and harmonizing the hundred creatures. And the ancestors of Chu also once had merit toward the world. After King Wu of Zhou defeated Zhou, King Cheng enfeoffed Uncle Yu in Tang. That land is naturally defensible, and with virtue they will parallel Zhou's decline, so they will surely rise.' Duke Huan said: 'Good.' Thus he finally spoke to the king and moved his people east beyond Luo, and Guo and Huo indeed offered ten cities, completing the state.

sentences.zh: 二歲，犬戎殺幽王於驪山下，并殺桓公。

translations.text: Two years later, the Dog Rong killed King You at the foot of Li Shan and also killed Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 鄭人共立其子掘突，是為武公。

translations.text: The people of Zheng together established his son Jue Tu, who became Duke Wu.
Two years later, the Dog Rong killed King You at the foot of Li Shan and also killed Duke Huan. The people of Zheng together established his son Jue Tu, who became Duke Wu.

sentences.zh: 武公十年，娶申侯女為夫人，曰武姜。

translations.text: In Duke Wu's tenth year, he took a daughter of the Marquis of Shen as his wife, named Wu Jiang.

sentences.zh: 生太子寤生，生之難，及生，夫人弗愛。

translations.text: She gave birth to the crown prince Wu Sheng, but the birth was difficult. After birth, the wife did not love him.

sentences.zh: 後生少子叔段，段生易，夫人愛之。

translations.text: Later she gave birth to a younger son, Uncle Duan. Duan was born easily, so the wife loved him.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，武公疾。

translations.text: In the twenty-seventh year, Duke Wu fell ill.

sentences.zh: 夫人請公，欲立段為太子，公弗聽。

translations.text: The wife requested the duke to establish Duan as crown prince, but the duke would not listen.

sentences.zh: 是歲，武公卒，寤生立，是為莊公。

translations.text: That year Duke Wu died, and Wu Sheng succeeded him, becoming Duke Zhuang.

In Duke Wu's tenth year, he took a daughter of the Marquis of Shen as his wife, named Wu Jiang. She gave birth to the crown prince Wu Sheng, but the birth was difficult. After birth, the wife did not love him. Later she gave birth to a younger son, Uncle Duan. Duan was born easily, so the wife loved him. In the twenty-seventh year, Duke Wu fell ill. The wife requested the duke to establish Duan as crown prince, but the duke would not listen. That year Duke Wu died, and Wu Sheng succeeded him, becoming Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 莊公元年，封弟段於京，號太叔。

translations.text: In Duke Zhuang's first year, he enfeoffed his younger brother Duan in Jing, calling him Uncle Tai.

sentences.zh: 祭仲曰：「京大於國，非所以封庶也。」

translations.text: Ji Zhong said: 'Jing is larger than the capital - this is not how to enfeoff a younger son.'

sentences.zh: 莊公曰：「武姜欲之，我弗敢奪也。」

translations.text: Duke Zhuang said: 'Wu Jiang wants it - I dare not refuse her.'

sentences.zh: 段至京，繕治甲兵，與其母武姜謀襲鄭。

translations.text: Duan went to Jing and prepared weapons and armor, plotting with his mother Wu Jiang to attack Zheng.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，段果襲鄭，武姜為內應。

translations.text: In the twenty-second year, Duan indeed attacked Zheng, with Wu Jiang as internal supporter.

sentences.zh: 莊公發兵伐段，段走。

translations.text: Duke Zhuang sent troops to attack Duan, and Duan fled.

sentences.zh: 伐京，京人畔段，段出走鄢。

translations.text: He attacked Jing, and the people of Jing rebelled against Duan. Duan fled to Yan.

sentences.zh: 鄢潰，段出奔共。

translations.text: Yan collapsed, and Duan fled to Gong.

sentences.zh: 於是莊公遷其母武姜於城潁，誓言曰：「不至黃泉，毋相見也。」

translations.text: Thus Duke Zhuang moved his mother Wu Jiang to Cheng Ying, swearing: 'Not until we reach the Yellow Springs shall we meet again.'

sentences.zh: 居歲餘，已悔思母。

translations.text: After living there more than a year, he already regretted and thought of his mother.

sentences.zh: 潁谷之考叔有獻於公，公賜食。

translations.text: Kao Shu of Ying Gu had an offering to the duke, and the duke granted him food.

sentences.zh: 考叔曰：「臣有母，請君食賜臣母。」

translations.text: Kao Shu said: 'I have a mother - please let the duke's food be granted to my mother.'

sentences.zh: 莊公曰：「我甚思母，惡負盟，柰何？」

translations.text: Duke Zhuang said: 'I greatly miss my mother, but hate to break my oath - what can I do?'

sentences.zh: 考叔曰：「穿地至黃泉，則相見矣。」

translations.text: Kao Shu said: 'Dig a tunnel to the Yellow Springs, then you can meet.'

sentences.zh: 於是遂從之，見母。

translations.text: Thus he followed this plan and met his mother.

In Duke Zhuang's first year, he enfeoffed his younger brother Duan in Jing, calling him Uncle Tai. Ji Zhong said: 'Jing is larger than the capital - this is not how to enfeoff a younger son.' Duke Zhuang said: 'Wu Jiang wants it - I dare not refuse her.' Duan went to Jing and prepared weapons and armor, plotting with his mother Wu Jiang to attack Zheng. In the twenty-second year, Duan indeed attacked Zheng, with Wu Jiang as internal supporter. Duke Zhuang sent troops to attack Duan, and Duan fled. He attacked Jing, and the people of Jing rebelled against Duan. Duan fled to Yan. Yan collapsed, and Duan fled to Gong. Thus Duke Zhuang moved his mother Wu Jiang to Cheng Ying, swearing: 'Not until we reach the Yellow Springs shall we meet again.' After living there more than a year, he already regretted and thought of his mother. Kao Shu of Ying Gu had an offering to the duke, and the duke granted him food. Kao Shu said: 'I have a mother - please let the duke's food be granted to my mother.' Duke Zhuang said: 'I greatly miss my mother, but hate to break my oath - what can I do?' Kao Shu said: 'Dig a tunnel to the Yellow Springs, then you can meet.' Thus he followed this plan and met his mother.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，宋繆公卒，公子馮奔鄭。

translations.text: Duke Zhuang reigned for forty-three years and died, and his son Li succeeded him, becoming Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 鄭侵周地，取禾。

translations.text: Duke Zhao's first year, he sent his younger brother Gong Shu Duan to govern the eastern border.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，衛州吁弒其君桓公自立，與宋伐鄭，以馮故也。

translations.text: Gong Shu Duan was arrogant and extravagant, and the people did not attach to him.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，始朝周桓王。

translations.text: In the fifth year, Prince Yi killed Duke Zhao at Dong Men.

sentences.zh: 桓王怒其取禾，弗禮也。

translations.text: The people of Zheng together established Gong Shu Duan, who became Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，莊公怒周弗禮，與魯易祊、許田。

translations.text: Duke Li's first year, he sent Prince Yi to Chu.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，宋殺孔父。

translations.text: In the fifth year, he sent his younger brother Yi to Chu.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，莊公不朝周，周桓王率陳、蔡、虢、衛伐鄭。

translations.text: In the fourteenth year, Duke Li returned from Chu.

sentences.zh: 莊公與祭仲、高渠彌發兵自救，王師大敗。

translations.text: In the fifteenth year, Prince Yi returned from Chu.

sentences.zh: 祝聸射中王臂。

translations.text: In the twentieth year, Duke Li died, and his son Yang succeeded him, becoming Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 祝聸請從之，鄭伯止之，曰：「犯長且難之，況敢陵天子乎？」

translations.text: Duke Wen's first year, Si Chen assassinated Duke Li at Dong Li and established Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.text: Duke Wen's third year, Chu invaded Zheng.

sentences.zh: 夜令祭仲問王疾。

translations.text: In the fifth year, Duke Wen died, and his son Shu succeeded him, becoming Duke Mu.

Duke Zhuang reigned for forty-three years and died, and his son Li succeeded him, becoming Duke Zhao. Duke Zhao's first year, he sent his younger brother Gong Shu Duan to govern the eastern border. Gong Shu Duan was arrogant and extravagant, and the people did not attach to him. In the fifth year, Prince Yi killed Duke Zhao at Dong Men. The people of Zheng together established Gong Shu Duan, who became Duke Li. Duke Li's first year, he sent Prince Yi to Chu. In the fifth year, he sent his younger brother Yi to Chu. In the fourteenth year, Duke Li returned from Chu. In the fifteenth year, Prince Yi returned from Chu. In the twentieth year, Duke Li died, and his son Yang succeeded him, becoming Duke Wen. Duke Wen's first year, Si Chen assassinated Duke Li at Dong Li and established Duke Wen. Duke Wen's third year, Chu invaded Zheng. In the fifth year, Duke Wen died, and his son Shu succeeded him, becoming Duke Mu.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，北戎伐齊，齊使求救，鄭遣太子忽將兵救齊。

translations.text: Duke Mu's first year, Song attacked Zheng and took the city of Long.

sentences.zh: 齊釐公欲妻之，忽謝曰：「我小國，非齊敵也。」

translations.text: In the fifth year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 時祭仲與俱，勸使取之，曰：「君多內寵，太子無大援將不立，三公子皆君也。」

translations.text: In the ninth year, Duke Mu died, and his son Lan succeeded him, becoming Duke Ling.

sentences.zh: 所謂三公子者，太子忽，其弟突，次弟子亹也。

translations.text: Duke Ling's first year, Song attacked Zheng.

Duke Mu's first year, Song attacked Zheng and took the city of Long. In the fifth year, Chu attacked Zheng. In the ninth year, Duke Mu died, and his son Lan succeeded him, becoming Duke Ling. Duke Ling's first year, Song attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 四十三年，鄭莊公卒。

translations.text: In the fifth year, Duke Ling died, and his son the Prince of Yu succeeded him, becoming Duke Xiang.

sentences.zh: 初，祭仲甚有寵於莊公，莊公使為卿；

translations.text: Duke Xiang's first year, Zheng attacked Song.

sentences.zh: 公使娶鄧女，生太子忽，故祭仲立之，是為昭公。

translations.text: In the fifth year, Duke Xiang died, and his son the Prince of Gong succeeded him, becoming Duke Jian.

In the fifth year, Duke Ling died, and his son the Prince of Yu succeeded him, becoming Duke Xiang. Duke Xiang's first year, Zheng attacked Song. In the fifth year, Duke Xiang died, and his son the Prince of Gong succeeded him, becoming Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 莊公又娶宋雍氏女，生厲公突。

translations.text: Duke Jian's first year, he married a woman from Song.

sentences.zh: 雍氏有寵於宋。

translations.text: In the eighth year, Duke Jian died, and his son the Prince of Yin succeeded him, becoming Duke Gong.

sentences.zh: 宋莊公聞祭仲之立忽，乃使人誘召祭仲而執之，曰：「不立突，將死。」

translations.text: Duke Gong's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 亦執突以求賂焉。

translations.text: In the fifth year, Duke Gong died, and his son the Prince of Fei succeeded him, becoming Duke Yi.

sentences.zh: 祭仲許宋，與宋盟。

translations.text: Duke Yi's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 以突歸，立之。

translations.text: In the seventh year, Duke Yi died, and his son the Prince of Dai succeeded him, becoming Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 昭公忽聞祭仲以宋要立其弟突，九月（辛）［丁］亥，忽出奔衛。

translations.text: Duke Huan's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 己亥，突至鄭，立，是為厲公。

translations.text: In the eighteenth year, Duke Huan died, and his son the Prince of Si succeeded him, becoming Duke Zhuang.

Duke Jian's first year, he married a woman from Song. In the eighth year, Duke Jian died, and his son the Prince of Yin succeeded him, becoming Duke Gong. Duke Gong's first year, Chu attacked Zheng. In the fifth year, Duke Gong died, and his son the Prince of Fei succeeded him, becoming Duke Yi. Duke Yi's first year, Chu attacked Zheng. In the seventh year, Duke Yi died, and his son the Prince of Dai succeeded him, becoming Duke Huan. Duke Huan's first year, Chu attacked Zheng. In the eighteenth year, Duke Huan died, and his son the Prince of Si succeeded him, becoming Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 厲公四年，祭仲專國政。

translations.text: Duke Zhuang's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 厲公患之，陰使其婿雍糾欲殺祭仲。

translations.text: In the third year, Duke Zhuang died, and his son the Prince of Ning succeeded him, becoming Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 糾妻，祭仲女也，知之，謂其母曰：「父與夫孰親？」

translations.text: Duke Zhao's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 母曰：「父一而已，人盡夫也。」

translations.text: In the twelfth year, Duke Zhao died, and his son the Prince of Xin succeeded him, becoming Duke Ding.

sentences.zh: 女乃告祭仲，祭仲反殺雍糾，戮之於市。

translations.text: Duke Ding's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 厲公無柰祭仲何，怒糾曰：「謀及婦人，死固宜哉！」

translations.text: In the fifth year, Duke Ding died, and his son the Prince of Yong succeeded him, becoming Duke Ai.

sentences.zh: 夏，厲公出居邊邑櫟。

translations.text: Duke Ai's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 祭仲迎昭公忽，六月乙亥，復入鄭，即位。

translations.text: In the twenty-seventh year, Duke Ai died, and his son the Prince of Tai succeeded him, becoming Duke Gong.

Duke Zhuang's first year, Chu attacked Zheng. In the third year, Duke Zhuang died, and his son the Prince of Ning succeeded him, becoming Duke Zhao. Duke Zhao's first year, Chu attacked Zheng. In the twelfth year, Duke Zhao died, and his son the Prince of Xin succeeded him, becoming Duke Ding. Duke Ding's first year, Chu attacked Zheng. In the fifth year, Duke Ding died, and his son the Prince of Yong succeeded him, becoming Duke Ai. Duke Ai's first year, Chu attacked Zheng. In the twenty-seventh year, Duke Ai died, and his son the Prince of Tai succeeded him, becoming Duke Gong.

sentences.zh: 秋，鄭厲公突因櫟人殺其大夫單伯，遂居之。

translations.text: Duke Gong's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 諸侯聞厲公出奔，伐鄭，弗克而去。

translations.text: In the ninth year, Duke Gong died, and his son the Prince of Yu succeeded him, becoming Duke Cheng.

sentences.zh: 宋頗予厲公兵，自守於櫟，鄭以故亦不伐櫟。

translations.text: Duke Cheng's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.
Duke Gong's first year, Chu attacked Zheng. In the ninth year, Duke Gong died, and his son the Prince of Yu succeeded him, becoming Duke Cheng. Duke Cheng's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 昭公二年，自昭公為太子時，父莊公欲以高渠彌為卿，太子忽惡之，莊公弗聽，卒用渠彌為卿。

translations.text: In the second year, Duke Cheng died, and his son the Prince of Lü succeeded him, becoming Duke Xiang.

sentences.zh: 及昭公即位，懼其殺己，冬十月辛卯，渠彌與昭公出獵，射殺昭公於野。

translations.text: Duke Xiang's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 祭仲與渠彌不敢入厲公，乃更立昭公弟子亹為君，是為子亹也，無謚號。

translations.text: In the twelfth year, Duke Xiang died, and his son the Prince of Chou succeeded him, becoming Duke Jian.

In the second year, Duke Cheng died, and his son the Prince of Lü succeeded him, becoming Duke Xiang. Duke Xiang's first year, Chu attacked Zheng. In the twelfth year, Duke Xiang died, and his son the Prince of Chou succeeded him, becoming Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 子亹元年七月，齊襄公會諸侯於首止，鄭子亹往會，高渠彌相，從，祭仲稱疾不行。

translations.text: Duke Jian's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 所以然者，子亹自齊襄公為公子之時，嘗會鬬，相仇，及會諸侯，祭仲請子亹無行。

translations.text: In the fourteenth year, Duke Jian died, and his son the Prince of Jin succeeded him, becoming Duke Ding.

sentences.zh: 子亹曰：「齊彊，而厲公居櫟，即不往，是率諸侯伐我，內厲公。

translations.text: Duke Ding's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 我不如往，往何遽必辱，且又何至是！」

translations.text: In the second year, Duke Ding died, and his son the Prince of Ning succeeded him, becoming Duke Ai.

sentences.zh: 卒行。

translations.text: Duke Ai's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

sentences.zh: 於是祭仲恐齊并殺之，故稱疾。

translations.text: In the ninth year, Duke Ai died, and his son the Prince of Gong succeeded him, becoming Duke Gong.

sentences.zh: 子亹至，不謝齊侯，齊侯怒，遂伏甲而殺子亹。

translations.text: Duke Gong's first year, Chu attacked Zheng.

translations.text: Duke Li first ascended the throne for four years, then fled and resided in Li. He resided in Li for seventeen years, then returned and ascended again, reigning seven years. His exile totaled twenty-eight years.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，文公之賤妾曰燕姞，夢天與之蘭，曰：「余為伯鯈。

translations.text: I am your ancestor.

In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Wen's lowly concubine named Yan Ji dreamed that Heaven gave her an orchid, saying: 'I am Bo Xiao. I am your ancestor. With this as your son, the orchid will have the fragrance of a state.' She told the dream to Duke Wen, who favored her and gave her an orchid plant as a token. Thus she gave birth to a son, named Lan.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，晉公子重耳過，文公弗禮。

sentences.zh: 文公弟叔詹曰：「重耳賢，且又同姓，窮而過君，不可無禮。」

translations.text: Duke Wen's younger brother Uncle Zhan said: 'Chong Er is worthy, and moreover we are of the same surname. He is destitute and passing through your domain - you cannot treat him discourteously.'

sentences.zh: 文公曰：「諸侯亡公子過者多矣，安能盡禮之！」

translations.text: Duke Wen said: 'Exiled princes of feudal lords who pass through are many - how can I treat them all with courtesy!'

sentences.zh: 詹曰：「君如弗禮，遂殺之；

translations.text: Zhan said: 'If your lordship does not treat him with courtesy, then kill him;

sentences.zh: 弗殺，使即反國，為鄭憂矣。」

translations.text: if you do not kill him, let him return to his state - it will become a worry for Zheng.'

translations.text: Duke Wen did not listen.

In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Chong Er of Jin passed through, and Duke Wen did not treat him with courtesy. Duke Wen's younger brother Uncle Zhan said: 'Chong Er is worthy, and moreover we are of the same surname. He is destitute and passing through your domain - you cannot treat him discourteously.' Duke Wen said: 'Exiled princes of feudal lords who pass through are many - how can I treat them all with courtesy!' Zhan said: 'If your lordship does not treat him with courtesy, then kill him; if you do not kill him, let him return to his state - it will become a worry for Zheng.' Duke Wen did not listen.

sentences.zh: 三十七年春，晉公子重耳反國，立，是為文公。

translations.text: In the thirty-seventh year, spring, Duke Chong Er of Jin returned to his state and ascended the throne, becoming Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 秋，鄭入滑，滑聽命，已而反與衛，於是鄭伐滑。

translations.text: Autumn, Zheng entered Hua, and Hua submitted, but then rebelled and allied with Wei, so Zheng attacked Hua.

sentences.zh: 周襄王使伯服請滑。

translations.text: King Xiang of Zhou sent Bo Fu to request on behalf of Hua.

sentences.zh: 鄭文公怨惠王之亡在櫟，而文公父厲公入之，而惠王不賜厲公爵祿，又怨襄王之與衛滑，故不聽襄王請而囚伯服。

translations.text: Duke Wen of Zheng resented that King Hui had fled to Li, and his father Duke Li had welcomed him, but King Hui did not grant Duke Li rank or salary. He also resented King Xiang for giving Wei and Hua to them, so he did not listen to King Xiang's request and imprisoned Bo Fu.

sentences.zh: 王怒，與翟人伐鄭，弗克。

translations.text: The king was angry and allied with the Di people to attack Zheng, but they were not victorious.

sentences.zh: 冬，翟攻伐襄王，襄王出奔鄭，鄭文公居王于氾。

translations.text: Winter, the Di attacked and drove out King Xiang, who fled to Zheng. Duke Wen of Zheng housed the king at Fan.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，晉文公入襄王成周。

translations.text: In the thirty-eighth year, Duke Wen of Jin entered King Xiang into Cheng Zhou.

In the thirty-seventh year, spring, Duke Chong Er of Jin returned to his state and ascended the throne, becoming Duke Wen. Autumn, Zheng entered Hua, and Hua submitted, but then rebelled and allied with Wei, so Zheng attacked Hua. King Xiang of Zhou sent Bo Fu to request on behalf of Hua. Duke Wen of Zheng resented that King Hui had fled to Li, and his father Duke Li had welcomed him, but King Hui did not grant Duke Li rank or salary. He also resented King Xiang for giving Wei and Hua to them, so he did not listen to King Xiang's request and imprisoned Bo Fu. The king was angry and allied with the Di people to attack Zheng, but they were not victorious. Winter, the Di attacked and drove out King Xiang, who fled to Zheng. Duke Wen of Zheng housed the king at Fan. In the thirty-eighth year, Duke Wen of Jin entered King Xiang into Cheng Zhou.

sentences.zh: 四十一年，助楚擊晉。

translations.text: In the forty-first year, Zheng assisted Chu in attacking Jin.

sentences.zh: 自晉文公之過無禮，故背晉助楚。

translations.text: Because Duke Wen of Jin had passed through without courtesy, Zheng turned against Jin and assisted Chu.

sentences.zh: 四十三年，晉文公與秦穆公共圍鄭，討其助楚攻晉者，及文公過時之無禮也。

translations.text: In the forty-third year, Duke Wen of Jin and Duke Mu of Qin together besieged Zheng, to punish Zheng for assisting Chu in attacking Jin, and for the discourtesy when Duke Wen passed through.

sentences.zh: 初，鄭文公有三夫人，寵子五人，皆以罪蚤死。

translations.text: Initially, Duke Wen of Zheng had three wives and five favored sons, all of whom died young due to crimes.

sentences.zh: 公怒，溉逐群公子。

translations.text: The duke was angry and drove away all the princes.

sentences.zh: 子蘭奔晉，從晉文公圍鄭。

translations.text: Zi Lan fled to Jin and followed Duke Wen of Jin in besieging Zheng.

sentences.zh: 時蘭事晉文公甚謹，愛幸之，乃私於晉，以求入鄭為太子。

translations.text: At the time, Lan served Duke Wen of Jin very carefully and was loved and favored by him, so he secretly negotiated with Jin to seek entry into Zheng as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 晉於是欲得叔詹為僇。

translations.text: Jin thus wanted to obtain Uncle Zhan to kill him.

sentences.zh: 鄭文公恐，不敢謂叔詹言。

translations.text: Duke Wen of Zheng was afraid and did not dare speak to Uncle Zhan.

sentences.zh: 詹聞，言於鄭君曰：「臣謂君，君不聽臣，晉卒為患。

translations.text: Zhan heard and said to the lord of Zheng: 'I advised your lordship, but your lordship did not listen. Jin has become a threat.

sentences.zh: 然晉所以圍鄭，以詹，詹死而赦鄭國，詹之願也。」

translations.text: However, the reason Jin besieges Zheng is because of Zhan. If Zhan dies and Zheng is pardoned, that is Zhan's wish.'

sentences.zh: 乃自殺。

translations.text: Thus he committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 鄭人以詹尸與晉。

translations.text: The people of Zheng gave Zhan's corpse to Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉文公曰：「必欲一見鄭君，辱之而去。」

translations.text: Duke Wen of Jin said: 'I must see the lord of Zheng to humiliate him, then leave.'

sentences.zh: 鄭人患之，乃使人私於秦曰：「破鄭益晉，非秦之利也。」

translations.text: The people of Zheng were troubled and sent someone to secretly tell Qin: 'If Zheng is broken, Jin will benefit - this is not advantageous for Qin.'

sentences.zh: 秦兵罷。

translations.text: The Qin troops withdrew.

sentences.zh: 晉文公欲入蘭為太子，以告鄭。

translations.text: Duke Wen of Jin wanted to enter Lan as crown prince and informed Zheng.

sentences.zh: 鄭大夫石癸曰：「吾聞姞姓乃后稷之元妃，其後當有興者。

translations.text: The Zheng grand master Shi Gui said: 'I have heard that the Ji surname is the first wife of Hou Ji, and their descendants should have rising ones.

sentences.zh: 子蘭母，其後也。

translations.text: Zi Lan's mother is their descendant.

sentences.zh: 且夫人子盡已死，餘庶子無如蘭賢。

translations.text: Moreover, the sons of the wife have all died, and among the remaining illegitimate sons, none is as worthy as Lan.

sentences.zh: 今圍急，晉以為請，利孰大焉！」

translations.text: Now the siege is urgent, and Jin requests this on our behalf - what benefit could be greater!'

sentences.zh: 遂許晉，與盟，而卒立子蘭為太子，晉兵乃罷去。

translations.text: Thus Zheng agreed to Jin and formed an alliance, finally establishing Zi Lan as crown prince. The Jin troops then withdrew.

In the forty-first year, Zheng assisted Chu in attacking Jin. Because Duke Wen of Jin had passed through without courtesy, Zheng turned against Jin and assisted Chu. In the forty-third year, Duke Wen of Jin and Duke Mu of Qin together besieged Zheng, to punish Zheng for assisting Chu in attacking Jin, and for the discourtesy when Duke Wen passed through. Initially, Duke Wen of Zheng had three wives and five favored sons, all of whom died young due to crimes. The duke was angry and drove away all the princes. Zi Lan fled to Jin and followed Duke Wen of Jin in besieging Zheng. At the time, Lan served Duke Wen of Jin very carefully and was loved and favored by him, so he secretly negotiated with Jin to seek entry into Zheng as crown prince. Jin thus wanted to obtain Uncle Zhan to kill him. Duke Wen of Zheng was afraid and did not dare speak to Uncle Zhan. Zhan heard and said to the lord of Zheng: 'I advised your lordship, but your lordship did not listen. Jin has become a threat. However, the reason Jin besieges Zheng is because of Zhan. If Zhan dies and Zheng is pardoned, that is Zhan's wish.' Thus he committed suicide. The people of Zheng gave Zhan's corpse to Jin. Duke Wen of Jin said: 'I must see the lord of Zheng to humiliate him, then leave.' The people of Zheng were troubled and sent someone to secretly tell Qin: 'If Zheng is broken, Jin will benefit - this is not advantageous for Qin.' The Qin troops withdrew. Duke Wen of Jin wanted to enter Lan as crown prince and informed Zheng. The Zheng grand master Shi Gui said: 'I have heard that the Ji surname is the first wife of Hou Ji, and their descendants should have rising ones. Zi Lan's mother is their descendant. Moreover, the sons of the wife have all died, and among the remaining illegitimate sons, none is as worthy as Lan. Now the siege is urgent, and Jin requests this on our behalf - what benefit could be greater!' Thus Zheng agreed to Jin and formed an alliance, finally establishing Zi Lan as crown prince. The Jin troops then withdrew.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，文公卒，子蘭立，是為繆公。

translations.text: In the forty-fifth year, Duke Wen died, and Zi Lan ascended the throne, becoming Duke Mu.
In the forty-fifth year, Duke Wen died, and Zi Lan ascended the throne, becoming Duke Mu.

sentences.zh: 繆公元年春，秦繆公使三將將兵欲襲鄭，至滑，逢鄭賈人弦高詐以十二牛勞軍，故秦兵不至而還，晉敗之於崤。

translations.text: In Duke Mu's first year, spring, Duke Mu of Qin sent three generals leading troops intending to attack Zheng by surprise, reaching Hua. They encountered the Zheng merchant Xian Gao, who deceived them by presenting twelve oxen to refresh the army, so the Qin troops did not arrive and returned. Jin defeated them at Xiao.

sentences.zh: 初，往年鄭文公之卒也，鄭司城繒賀以鄭情賣之，秦兵故來。

translations.text: Initially, in previous years when Duke Wen of Zheng died, the Zheng Director of Construction Zheng He betrayed Zheng's situation and sold it to Qin, which is why the Qin troops came.

sentences.zh: 三年，鄭發兵從晉伐秦，敗秦兵於汪。

translations.text: In the third year, Zheng sent troops to follow Jin in attacking Qin, defeating the Qin troops at Wang.

translations.text: In the twenty-first year, Chu allied with Song's Hua Yuan to attack Zheng.

translations.text: Hua Yuan killed a sheep and fed the soldiers, but did not give any to his charioteer Yang Zhen. Yang Zhen was angry and charged into Zheng, where Zheng imprisoned Hua Yuan.

sentences.zh: 晉使趙穿以兵伐鄭。
